item.title: Google is testing AI-powered article overviews on select publications’ Google News pages
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Google is testing AI-powered article overviews on participating publications’ Google News pages as part of a new pilot program, the search giant announced on Wednesday. News publishers participating in the pilot program include Der Spiegel, El País, Folha, Infobae, Kompas, The Guardian, The Times of India, The Washington Examiner, and The Washington Post, among others. […]

item.title: Amazon changes how copyright protection is applied to Kindle Direct’s self-published ebooks
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Amazon says its Kindle Direct DRM-free titles will be available as PDFs and EPUB files going forward.

item.title: ChatGPT is Apple’s most downloaded app of 2025 in the US
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: This is ChatGPT's first year as the No. 1 app on the U.S. App Store by downloads.

item.title: Amazon now offers same-day delivery of perishable groceries in 2,300 US cities
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The e-commerce giant says it will expand the service to additional cities in 2026.

item.title: Oboe raises $16 million from a16z for its AI-powered course generation platform
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Oboe has raised $16 million in funding for its learning app. The company now lets users generate unlimited courses for free.

item.title: Google launches managed MCP servers that let AI agents simply plug into its tools
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Google is rolling out managed MCP servers to make its services “agent-ready by design,” starting with Maps and BigQuery, aiming to simplify messy integrations and help AI agents use real tools.

item.title: Unacademy’s founder says startup is now worth less than $500M, confirms M&A talks
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Unacademy's valuation has dropped by over 85% from its pandemic-era peak price tag of $3.5 billion, its founder said.

item.title: AI startup Tavus founder says users talk to its AI Santa ‘for hours’ per day
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Tavus has launched a new experience where you can chat with an AI Santa that asks personal questions and remembers your interests.

item.title: Figma launches new AI-powered object removal and image extension
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Figma is launching a new image editing toolbar to bring all its features in one place.

item.title: Petco takes down Vetco website after exposing customers’ personal information
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: TechCrunch found Petco's veterinary clinics were spilling customers' personal information and medical histories of their pets to the open web.

item.title: Google launches sub-$5 AI Plus plan in India to compete with ChatGPT Go
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: For new users in India, Google is offering an AI Plus subscription for ₹199 ($2.21) for the first six months, after which you'll have to pay ₹399 ($4.44).

item.title: Instagram’s new ‘Your Algorithm’ tool gives you more control over the Reels you see
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: You can select which topics you want to see more or less of, and your recommendations will adapt accordingly.

item.title: Adobe brings Photoshop, Express and Acrobat features to ChatGPT
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: ChatGPT's 800 million plus userbase can now use Adobe's apps to modify images and PDFs

item.title: Amazon to invest additional $35B in India by 2030, taking total planned spending to $75B
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: The e-commerce giant said the new investment will support its efforts to digitize small businesses and strengthen its logistics and operations footprint in India.

item.title: Google invests in Fervo’s $462M round to unlock even more geothermal energy
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Fervo Energy's Series E round will help the company build additional phases of its Cape Station power plant while beginning development on new sites.

item.title: Meesho’s $606M IPO pops as enthusiasm for India’s e-commerce startups rises
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Meesho had a good first day as a public company, with its shares climbing as much as 46% from its issue price as investors jumped to grab a piece of the company built around small merchants and value-conscious consumers.

item.title: Fertility startup Inito wants to use AI-designed antibodies to expand at-home health tests
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Inito has raised $29 million in new funding to invest in and develop AI-engineered antibodies that will help it offer new types of tests and improve the accuracy of existing ones.

item.title: CoreWeave CEO defends AI circular deals as ‘working together’
item.dc:creator: Lucas.ropek
item.description: The CEO of the AI data center provider, which has Nvidia as an investor and a supplier, described the environment as a "violent change" in demand.

item.title: Unconventional AI confirms its massive $475M seed round
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Led by Naveen Rao, the former head of AI at Databricks, the new hardware startup is valued at $4.5 billion.

item.title: Hinge CEO steps down to launch Overtone, an AI dating app
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Overtone is described as "an early-stage dating service focused on using AI and voice tools to help people connect in a more thoughtful and personal way."
